lines.text: Remember, the next time the Wild Bunch pulls a job, we were ready to quit for good and join the Army! You wouldn't give us a chance.
You know, I've been doin' a lot of thinkin' lately about all this. Sleepin' out at night... bein' gunned for... chased from one county to the next.
You knew that when you turned outlaw.
That's just it. I never turned - never been anything else. Not since I was ten.
They really keep money in here?
It's a bank, isn't it?
That's a matter of opinion.
About that side door - I'd keep it locked. In case some hombre tries to rob you - it's an easy way out.
You men obviously know much about bancos. You were perhaps in the banking business?
Hmm, yeah. I guess you could say that.
In a way.
One good sneeze'll open that vault.
Then we'll make sure no one catches cold.
Quite a change, isn't it? Back in the States, anyone pull a job, they'd blame it on the Wild Bunch. Down here, we pull a job, they blame it on El Gallo.
It's bad luck.
Didn't you always say The Wild Bunch made its own luck?
Well, it looks like the end of the line, Kid. A lot of years and a lot of ridin'.
It's those railroad detectives. If they'd just let us alone. They're the cause of all this.
No, I'm blamin' my old man.
What are you talkin' about?
Well, when I was ten, if he'd hired an honest foreman instead of a rustler, I'da probably grown up respectable.
[last lines]
I suppose you will be leaving us now.
Yeah, soon.
They tell me, United States is a beautiful country.
Why don't you pay us a visit? I could show you around. Good bye!
